movesets.name: All-Out Attacker

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Fake Out is Ambipom's main niche, scoring free, powerful damage on the opponent due to STAB and Technician. However, it very easily telegraphs Ambipom's attack, and the overwhelming presence of Pokemon such as Doublade, Alomomola, and Rhyperior means that Ambipom will often be nothing more than a free switch to a top threat. Return is Ambipom's most reliable attack and main way of dealing damage. Low Kick trips up Pokemon that resist Normal-type moves such as Cobalion, Registeel, and Rhyperior, and it can do serious damage due to their high weights. Knock Off strikes Ghost-types while also removing the items of defensive Pokemon to soften them up and make them easier to KO. U-turn can be used to gain momentum on opponents wanting to escape from Fake Out, while Pursuit targets the fleeing foes themselves and is especially effective on Dark-weak targets such as Delphox and Meloetta. Double Hit can be used to break Substitutes, but its chance to miss makes it unappealing for such a frail Pokemon that already has access to a much more accurate attacking option with similar power in Return, and Cinccino does this better anyway.

Set Details

Maximum Speed investment allows Ambipom to outrun speedy Pokemon such as Heliolisk and Virizion, while max Attack investment maximizes Ambipom's damage output. The rest of the EVs go into either defensive stat, preferably Defense to take priority moves better, because Ambipom's current HP is an optimal Life Orb number, so it would be a waste to throw the leftover EVs in HP. Silk Scarf is a perfectly viable alternative to Life Orb, as Silk Scarf does not cause recoil and still boosts Ambipom's main attacks, although its coverage moves will be substantially weaker.

Usage Tips

Ambipom is a very straightforward attacker. It checks frail sweepers that lack Protect with its powerful Fake Out regardless of their Speed. From there, Ambipom dishes out quick, reliable damage, with few foes outright resisting its attacks. Although Fake Out is usually quite safe to throw out, it is advisable to only use it if an opponent is certain to stay in, as the threat of a strong Fake Out can easily force out most frail attackers, and nailing the switch-in with the appropriate coverage move can be more practical. Ambipom can struggle to safely revenge kill Pokemon that are behind a Substitute, such as Moltres, Meloetta, and Cresselia, as they can dodge Fake Out's flinching effect. Ambipom also shouldn't switch into non-Ghost-type attack, as it thrives on revenge killing, or if it must be switched in it should at least be brought into battle via slow U-turns or Volt Switches.

Team Options

As Ambipom forces switches so easily, entry hazards support is really useful to discourage switch-ins as well as soften up Ambipom's counters. Qwilfish makes for an amazing teammate, since it easily takes Fighting-type moves for Ambipom and lays down Spikes, which is effective because the majority of Ambipom's switch-in are grounded; Accelgor is also an effective user of Spikes for more offensive teams. On the other hand, Fighting-resistant teammates with Toxic Spikes, such as Qwilfish, Cofagrigus, and Weezing, are more plentiful. Toxic Spikes are potent against Regenerator users but they do not work against Steel-types and airborne Pokemon. Ambipom struggles against physically bulky Pokemon, so wallbreakers such as Clawitzer, Eelektross, Calm Mind Delphox, and Reuniclus can help Ambipom clean without much hindrance by dismantling the opponent's defensive cores. Fighting-types such as Cobalion, Virizion, and Hitmonlee can take out the Rock- and Steel-types that Ambipom cannot break through, while Ambipom can lure out problematic Ghost-types and weaken them with Knock Off. While not essential, slow Volt Switch or U-turn users can help bring Ambipom in safely; Clawitzer, Eelektross, and Magneton can all provide this support, and pack enough power and/or coverage to threaten bulkier foes that Ambipom cannot take down.

moves.name: Acrobatics
moves.description: Doubles in power if user has no held item.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Agility
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Astonish
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Baton Pass
moves.description: User switches, but passes on all stat changes and some special conditions.

moves.name: Beat Up
moves.description: All healthy Pokemon aid in damaging the target.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn. 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Covet
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Hit
moves.description: Hits 2 times in one turn.

moves.name: Double Slap
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in 1 turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Dynamic Punch
moves.description: Confuses the foe.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.description: The user always moves first, and flinches the foe. Can only be used on the first turn out.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Punch
moves.description: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Fury Cutter
moves.description: Power doubles with each consecutive hit.

moves.name: Fury Swipes
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Gunk Shot
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dark
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dragon
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Water
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hone Claws
moves.description: Boosts Attack and accuracy one stage.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Ice Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Iron Tail
moves.description: 30% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Last Resort
moves.description: Can only be used if all other moves have been used once.

moves.name: Low Kick
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Low Sweep
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mega Kick
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Mega Punch
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Metronome
moves.description: Picks a random move.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Nasty Plot
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Nightmare
moves.description: Does 1/4 of the target's max HP per turn to a sleeping target.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.name: Quick Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from priority attacks.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Revenge
moves.description: Doubles in power if damaged.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sand Attack
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Scratch
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Screech
moves.description: Lowers foe's Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Seismic Toss
moves.description: Does damage equal to the user's level.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shadow Claw
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Shock Wave
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Slam
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Spite
moves.description: Lowers the PP of the move used last by 1-5.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Switcheroo
moves.description: Switches items with the target.

moves.name: Tail Whip
moves.description: Lowers foe's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Tickle
moves.description: Lowers Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: If the wielder has no held item, it gets the last item consumed at the end of the turn. Adds a chance of finding an item after each battle.

abilities.name: Skill Link
abilities.description: Multi-hit moves will always hit the maximum number of times.

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: Increases power of moves with 60 base power or less by 50%.
